item.title: Welfare Effects of Personalized Rankings
item.dc:creator: Robert Donnelly, Ayush Kanodia, and Ilya Morozov
item.description:
Developed a novel latent-factorization model in PyTorch for customer search and used it to measure the impact of personalized search research on customer welfare based on data from an experiment run at Wayfair.

Download paper here

item.title: Counterfactual inference for consumer choice across many product categories
item.dc:creator: Rob Donnelly, Fran Ruiz, David Blei, and Susan Athey
item.description:
Developed a variational Bayesian model of customer behavior in grocery stores to understand how they substitute between products when prices and product availability changes. Validated the ability of the model to make counterfactual predictions using held out data from weeks that experienced changes in pricing or out-of-stock products.

Download paper here

item.title: Estimating heterogeneous consumer preferences for restaurants and travel time using mobile location data
item.dc:creator: Athey, Susan, David Blei, Robert Donnelly, Francisco Ruiz, and Tobias Schmidt
item.description:
We estimate a model of consumer choices over restaurants using data from thousands of anonymous mobile phone users. We analyze how consumers reallocate their demand after a restaurant closes and make predictions about what types of restaurants would attract the most customers in a given location.

Download paper here
